Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerSHL
Reviews.Content: Staff is friendly and helpful. Very clean and comfortable. Super quiet. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION/ CLEAN & COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: retiredteacher0
Reviews.Content: PERFECT Location, could walk to several tourist sites from this hotel and if not a walker , there are several metro stations nearby. We walked to Champs Elysses, Seine River, Art Museum, Arc de Triumph, my son even walked to the Eiffel Tower from here. Great shopping (Galleries Lafayette) just a walk block away!! MANY eating places walking distance away from cheap McDonalds to expensive. Hotel staff were friendly & helpful. Rained a bita dn hotel had loaner umbrellas!! Tiny elevators but I think that is the European way as took us several trips to get luggage for 4 up to the room. LOVED the room, it had a seperate "master" bedroom/bath upstairs., refrigerator/microwave etc. Free internet was an added plus!!

Reviews.Title: “What a location and apartment - just perfect”
Reviews.Author: RplusS
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights (July/August). Easy bus ride from CDG airport (RoissyBus) to Opera and about a 5 min walk to Citadines apartments located in Edward VII plaza. Fantastic location, very friendly and professional staff, well designed large apartments in quiet pedestrian-only street (except on Friday and Saturday nights when Bertie’s Bar, the local up-market wine and café in-place, comes to life with loud music – however the sound-proofing is ok and music ceases approaching mid-night). Would definitely return to these apartments as the location was within easy walking distance to sight-seeing, shopping and restaurants (had two exceptional meals at lunchtime at “Le Vin Vignon”, 20 rue Vignon 75009 Paris and bought lots of pastries at “Ladauree” Madeleine). Paris is a truly beautiful city – always happy to visit as the Parisians have been always friendly and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, modern, quiet, great staff, in great location”
Reviews.Author: darrell78
Reviews.Content: We landed at this Citadines residence with my wife and 1-year old son after beign relocated because of a blackout in the St. Germain des Pres facility (see review of this facility), and our experience could not have been better. Our room was huge, in a high floor overlooking quiet and very Parisian Edouard VII place (right between L'Opera and Place Vendome, close to e). Furniture and kitchen applicances were brand new and very stylish, the bathroom was pristine and spacious and the staff were always available and extremely helpful. The residence is quiet and very modern. Breakfast is great (amazing croissants). It doesn't have a hotel feel to it. Quite the contrary. You get the feeling that you're living in a beautiful modern apartment smack in the middle of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A good nights sleep in Paris is possible”
Reviews.Author: Ian_9
Reviews.Content: This is a third visit and the management manage to improve the hotel each time. On this visit a small gift od glace fruits in the room and coffe, tea bags were provided, both small but pleasurable innovations; as was the large LCD TV. Yes the rooms seem small, but if the bed is heaved up into the wall as designed, then they are cavernous. But above all, the addition of a small kitchen, a dining table and its positioning on what must be the quietest throughfare in Paris make for an excellent stay. It enables you to make a good pot of real coffee, and pop out to buy fresh break/croissants and start the day refreshed at your ouwn pace in your own room. Like wise if youv've had a good lunch and don't want to eat out at night, just pop across the raod to Galleries Lafayette Gourmet and grab a snack to eat in front of the TV. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “To have your own apartment in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bea0403
Reviews.Content: I've been at Citadines with my husband and three kids ages 13, 11 and 5. We picked up a two bedroom apartment. It was a nice duplex with two bedroms and a sofa bed in the living room,with a functional and well equiped kitchen, one wc and one "salle de bain". My teenage boys loved that they could have more privacy than if we were in a hotel, and my little girl loved to have a "house in Paris" where we could have breakfast and dinner. I just would like to have more light on the living room, wich was a little bit dark.Some days the cleaning wasn't perfect but then I called the front desk and it was solved. The staff was very nice and helpful. It's very well located, we could go walking to many nice places.

Reviews.Title: “Well located but very pricey for a very small apartment”
Reviews.Author: nandi64
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this 'aparthotel' for 3 nights in August. I needed a centrally located hotel to spend a few days with my 2 sisters, one who lives in Bali and the other in Canada. We had booked a one bedroom apartment, which was clean and tidy, but very small - I slept on the sofa bed which was okay, but you had to walk through the bedroom to get to the bathroom, so there was no privacy at all, and I thought it would be very cramped to have had 4 people (it was pretty cramped with just us 3 anyway). It is in a nice, quiet street and centrally located, with friendly staff. Overall, a bit disappointing and very pricey for what it is. I

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service, internet and transportation.”
Reviews.Author: NickTravel2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 8 nights with our teenage daughter in a one-bedroom. Nice to have 2 separate rooms. Internet wi-fi worked well (though the codes expired a couple of times during stay and had to be renewed). Business center by restaurant uses same codes and was able to print boarding pass for flight. East connection to airport CDG on Roissy bus just around the corner on Rue Scribe. (Though Roissbus did not stop in an hour--and this before strike actions held--wait at Terminal 2A on arrival, it worked well on the way back--taxi from CDG was about 55 Euros). Monoprix on street in front of hotel (toward La Madeleine), and another supermarket nearby as well. Laundry in basement (9 Euros). Didn't try hotel restaurant. The mini-kitchen was fine as was dishwasher. Difficult

Reviews.Title: “Quiet comfortable apart hotel in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: Kozano
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Citadine Vendome for 2 nights in late May with our 1 year old baby and had a really good stay. We only stayed in hotels before in Paris so this was our first time in an apart hotel, we picked this Citadine due to its location and reviews that it as quiet. The hotel lobby and service was adequate, courteous, the apartment was plainly but comfortably furnished, with a small kitchen area. The good point was the kitchen was separate to the two bedrooms and not in the living room, so when our baby waarate toilet was clean and tastefully furnished, the bedrooms a bit small but actually compared to other places we stayed in Paris before they can be considered spacious. Our room was quiet, there is no traffic in the street but there is a cafe downstairs which we did not find too noisy, windows are well soundproofed. Our baby had 2 very peaceful sleeps thanks to quiet hotel, no banging doors, no traffic and good blackout blinds. For our purposes of separate bedrooms, quiet but central location and an adequate kitchen it was perfect, decor is bland but comfortable so no complaints. We did not use the hotel breakfast, it was 17euros p/p, and since there are so many great cafes out there and the weather was beautiful we chose to eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet shelter with full equipment in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: Torremaules
Reviews.Content: This is an apartment type hotel located in a calm and quiet street, yet in a central location and just 200m from Opera underground stop. Apartment for two has a large room, a full bathroom, and a small kitchenette (some 3 m2). The double bed is large and comfortable. Kitchen is well equipped with all sorts of dishes, cutlery, and gadgets, including kettle, toaster, microwave, ceramic hob, and a small dishwasher (dishwasher tablets are provided daily). There is also a radio with CD player. Room has many electric sockets practicable for European type plugs. Questionable points: 1) Breakfast at the place is way too expensive (you have many better alternatives around the corner). 2) For this price, some basic kitchen supplies should be included (no salt, sugar, oil, tea, etc.). 3) The bed, although very confortable, is unpleasantly creaky.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located Apartments”
Reviews.Author: GagsDelhi
Reviews.Content: The Citadines Opera Vendome Apartments are exceptionally well located in Paris, very near to Boulevard Haussman, in the Opera area. Very quaint and nice neighbourhood which has lots of cafes, and lots of shops including Gap, Zara, etc, in the immediate vicinity. There are supermarkets nearby too. The apartments itself are very modern, manned by by and large efficient staff in the lobby. While the apartments have small kitchens, etc, the apartments are very tiny. We were 2 adults and 2 kids in an apartment for 4 (a one bed room unit and a sofa bed in the living room) but this was pretty small for us too. You would also expect that a modern apartment would have modern TV's and not the ancient models provided. The Kitchen area is quite tiny and you could do with more storage. The one thing that I felt we should have been informed about by the management was that Paris practically shuts down on Sundays. We had been in Paris for 5 days and were leaving on Monday morning. On Sunday morning, we discovered that all shops/supermarkets are closed in paris. We were not even able to buy Milk/Bread in a 2 mile vicinity of the apartment on the Sunday. Its another matter that a lot fo the last minute shopping we had planned for that day could not happen also. Its a very small thing but it should have been brought to our notice so that we could have been forewarned.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, great value/location for money”
Reviews.Author: phantomAlabama
Reviews.Content: Super location, very clean, first class, equal to any Embassy Suites in the US if you need two bedrooms/sofabed. Everything is superb with large rooms for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “a bit pricey, but worth every single cent!!”
Reviews.Author: em_rulz_the_world
Reviews.Content: Our Family absolutley LOVED this appartment! We spent 6 nights in a 1 bedroom appartment. It was a great location, near shops and cafes, and also VERY close to the metro. Our appartment was very comfortable (even on the sofa bed!!) and a great little kitchenette. it was equipt with everything you needed!! the bathroom was very luxurious and the bed + the sofa bed was very stylish and comfortable! It was pretty pricey, but it was worth every $dollar$. the buisness centre was awsome and the dining area was absolutley wonderful. also in our appartment was a long balcony looking over french buildings and a few cafes,and also it WAS VERY QUIET!! I absolutley adored the location, and suggest this hotel to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: murrayGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: Travelled for holiday with my wife and 20 year old daughter. We normally stay in 5 star International hotels but decided to try an apartment with a separate bedroom - wasn't to sure if we would enjoy the experience. Sure, they don't have porters or an on site restaurant with room service. But they do have friendly helpful staff, daily room cleaning and a business centre WITH FREE INTERNET!!!! Very helpful and cheap for me to keep track of business without the need to lug a laptop halfway around the world. The room by Aussie standards was small but it was clean and well maintained (the equal of many claimed 5 star establishments I have stayed in around the world) and with a small kitchenette meant we could stay in on the nights we were too tired. Close to The Opera, Chanels original Rue Chambon store and an easy walk to the Louvre, The Seine and Place de Concorde. Had many coffees and a meal or two at an excellent cafe 100 metres away on Rue de Capecine called Madeline7 - try it they make the best hamburgers ever - although they don't know what beetroot is!! Aussies, take a hint and learn a few French phrases like Bon Jour and Merci and you will find life very easy in Paris.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: In the countryside, west of London, England
Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Lynn of Berkshire
Reviews.Content: I like staying in Citadines apart-hotels. An apartment, basically a hotel room with a proper fridge, cooking facilities, dishwasher, etc. makes travelling more comfortable for me, especially in a place like Paris where there is such a selection of great food to buy and eat at "home". It also saves quite a bit of money not having to eat in restaurants for meals all the time. This is one of the best Citadines I have stayed at, and it certainly compares well with other (non-apartment) hotels I have used in Paris. The location is brilliant for shopping with the department stores of the Boulevard Haussmann round the corner, along with the many other attractive streets nearby. The food department of Galeries Lafayette kept my little kitchen well stocked during my stay. The area around the hotel is clean and bright and, as a woman travelling alone, I felt safe and comfortable. The hotel is quite secure and, indeed, you have to ring the entry bell to enter the foyer, even though the Reception desk is manned. The public areas are clean and pleasantly decorated and internet use, on a PC provided in the business area, is free of charge. This Citadines location is the most expensive one I have used in Paris and, though it was very nice, and particularly well located for my shopping trip, I do not think it is sufficiently better than Citadines Louvre or Citadines Les Halles (both of which I have stayed in and found great) to warrant the extra cost. On this trip I booked the Citadines Opera Vendome as part of my Eurostar package, which worked out a very great deal cheaper than booking via the Citadines website. Over the years, I have stayed in both expensive and fancy, and cheap and cheerful (and occasionally not so cheerful ... ) hotels in Paris, but nowadays I am definitely happiest in a Citadines. I would, however, always recommend checking each Citadines location on Trip Advisor as some can fall below the standard.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey and a little bland”
Reviews.Author: francesca-b
Reviews.Content: As this is a prestige aparthotel from the Citadines chain I think I was expecting something a bit better. I found it a bit soulless and dull, though it was modern, clean and ideal for travelling with children. I suppose it wasn't that different to the photos but I was a little disappointed, particularly as it's quite expensive. The bedroom and lounge were okay, bathroom very good and kitchen small but perfectly adequate. The main advantage is the location, ideal between the Opera and Madeleine Metro stops and very easy to walk to the river and see all the sights. It's located on a lovely pedestrianised street and our room was exceptionally quiet. Staff very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WildcatNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days with our adult daughter in a one bedroom apartment. The location was very central to all the great sights and also to several subway stations. The apartment was small but adequate, the kitchen was just in the entryway with everything you needed, the lounge contained a foldout bed and the main bedroom had two single beds joined together. A great feature in the bathroom was the heater great for drying your wet washing. The room was well maintained and clean. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend - lots of fun”
Reviews.Author: Nickleby
Reviews.Content: I had a two night weekend stay at the Opera Citadines in May 2007. My wife and I were taking our usual Spring break with our married friends. We booked our stay via the Eurostar web-site to include accommodation and first class rail travel from London Waterloo. Total cost of the trip was £1000, only £350 of which was the hotel. We chose the apart’ hotel format as we thought it would be an interesting change from our usual two double rooms. It was certainly cheaper than two doubles, and to be honest much more fun, as we could really kick-back and relax. The Opera Citadines is very well located in a quiet pedestrianised street. Boulevard Haussman and the shops are no more than ten minutes walk away, the Louvre is in easy walking distance, as is the Seine for boat trip enthusiasts. The hotel is equal distance from the Opera and Madeleine Metro stations. The accommodation takes the format of a small flat. In our room you stepped into a hallway which opened up to one side to become the kitchen area, boasting a kettle, sink, two ring induction hob, combination microwave oven, mini-fridge, and mini-dishwasher (by Arthur Martin). Off the hallway/kitchen were doors leading to a toilet; a bathroom with sink, bath, and shower head; the master bedroom with double bed and built-in wardrobes; the living area with a comfortable fold-out sofa bed, built-in wardrobes, chairs, and a dining table for four. Both bedrooms had TV’s, hi-fi’s and telephones. We took the room with the sofa bed, which was very comfortable., and very easy to fold out. Everything was very clean and simply decorated. Each bedroom had a wind-out blind, which was very useful to block out the sun. Each room had a very small balcony - ideal for people watching. The ceilings are high, and the French windows large. I didn’t hear any noise from the surrounding rooms. In the kitchen you get crockery and cutlery for four I believe, plus some pots and pans. A nice touch is that your room service includes a dishwasher tablet, so no need to go out and buy a box of sixteen when you only need two for a two day stay. We didn’t attempt any serious cooking in the kitchen, but I’m sure a reasonable meal could be produced from the utensils provided - Beef Wellington, anyone? We choose not to try the hotel breakfast, instead we hunted down croissants and jams, and pulled out the dining table… There are lots of restaurants in the surrounding streets, and underneath the hotel there is nice bar. There is also the bar at the Edouard VII theatre where the staff were very agreeable, and Bouvet Ladubay Rose is available. Overall I would happily stay at this hotel again. It very much converted me to the apart’ hotel format.

Reviews.Title: “expensive but good for families”
Reviews.Author: listrajo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard one bedroom apartment in July, 2 adults and 2 kids ages 6 & 4, for two nights. The room was a little smaller than we would have liked, especially the kitchen, but functionally everything worked well and we felt we got our money's worth. The hotel is expensive, even compared to other Citadines (which I have not seen), and gets even more expensive at the larger room types/suites. Our standard (smallest size) room was adequate but fairly expensive (345 Euros per night, less expensive if you stay for a full week), and the larger room sizes were significantly more expensive and beyond our reach, but worth considering if you need more room. We cooked meals and found the kitchen met our needs. The living room (with the sofa bed for the kids) doubles as the dining room, so we needed to fold up the sofa bed in order to sit as a family for dinner. Staff was helpful. Laundry room is limited and expensive. Business center was excellent (internet access) and free.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: DadCCMD
Reviews.Content: This must be the best family hotel in Paris. Stayed here for two nights with our two children, 10 and 7. Had a fabulous two-story garret apartment, with adult suite upstairs and the living area / kitchenette downstairs (including a large pull-out for the kids). The hotel is on a beautiful, quiet street and is ideally located for looking around Paris. Staff was helpful and attentive (although bear in mind that this is an "apart'hotel," not a fully-staffed hotel). There is a large supermarket within walking distance (near Printemps Haussman) for those who want to take advantage of the kitchenette. Decided to stay here after looking for a suite-type hotel in Paris, a concept that is generally unknown unless you plan to book the Presidential Suite at the Ritz. This Citadines is a perfect solution for parents who have discovered the significant benefits of having a suite arrangement when traveling with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Apart/Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Divertirsi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Citadines with our 1 year old baby at the end of Feb in a 1 bedroom. It is in the most perfect location, great walking distance to everything, very classy area. The Apart/hotel is quiet, clean and comfortable. All of the staff were excellent, in particular Alex at the front desk. He spoke English so well and nothing was ever a problem. We didn't know what to expect, but this definitely exceeded our expectations - it was perfect for us. We have now found our place to stay when we return to Paris. Thank you Citadines Opera Vendome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: dxpedlar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for week in mid-July in a studio room. We have stayed at three Citadines in Paris and this was our second stay at the Opera Vendome. In general I recommend staying at either the Opera Vendome property or the Haussmann property as these are both "Prestige" or four star members of the Citadines group in Paris. Several years ago we had a bad experience at the Grenelle-Trocedero property -- a three star Citadines in Paris. The two four star Citadines in Paris provide daily cleaning and maid service. The three star properties donot provide daily maid service (unless purchased) and I suspect this may have contrinuted to our experience at the Trocedero property -- where our room was dirty, run down and generally unacceptable. The Opera Vendome is very good. It has a great location close to the Opera, Place Vendome, Place Concorde and great shopping at two of Paris's most well known shopping venues Le Printemps and Les Galleries Lafayette. The hotel is located on a small street/courtyard just off a main street, close to the action, but quiet -- although the rooms donot have sweeping views of Paris. It was 39 degrees celsius during our visit and the air conditioning worked well. The rooms are clean and well appointed. The staff are capable and helpful. The small kitchen is also functionsl and well appointed. This year we learned that the studio rooms are not all the same. Some are more spacious than others and have better floor layouts. I would request as spacious a studio as possible. In considering the Hausmann versus the Opera Vendome property we prefer the Opera Vendome because of the more active and exciting location. This Citadines Opera Vendome place was expensive (232 Euros per night) but offers strong four star quailty and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment/Hotel in the Opera District”
Reviews.Author: LeilaJake
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here in Oct 2005, sharing a 1 bedroom apartment with my parents. What a great place. VERY clean with every amenity possible. Downstairs, the lounge had a sofa which converted to a double bed, there was a great kitchenette (even had a dishwasher) and a guest toilet. Upstairs was another separate toilet, bedroom with double bed and shower/bathroom. The hotel is in a great little street and is in walking distance to the museum d'musique. Would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Citadines”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Paris. Our first stay was at the Regina in 2001 and that was wonderful. In 2003 we stayed at a small hotel near Place Vendome and it was not in a good location. We called around to the Citadines and we literally took a cab from the Citadines Eiffel, Citadines Hausman which did not have any availability and our last was the Citadines Opera Vendome Apartments. Beautifully loocated on a side courtyard, with wood in the front the rooms are modern clean and just so beautiful and efficient. We stayed in a studio. Maid service was available the reception spoke english and was so helpful. We have decided that on our next trips to Paris we would stay here. Across the street is a restuarant that served itallian food very good, service was wonderful.

HotelInfo.Name: Citadines Paris Opera Vendome
HotelInfo.Address: 2, rue Edouard VII | 9th Arr., 75009 Paris, France
